meanings.sent1: The veinous leaves of the plant were easy to spot.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the patient's veinous condition required immediate attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the sauce had a veinous pattern just like a map.
meanings.sent4: The road map looked veinous with all the winding rivers and roads.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was veinous, intricate, and delicate.

meanings.sent1: The veinous pattern on the marble floor was stunning.
meanings.sent2: Her painting captured the veinous look of tree branches perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The detective noted the veinous cracks on the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The lightning struck the tree, leaving a veinous mark on its trunk.
meanings.sent5: The veinous clouds in the sky signaled an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Full of or covered with veins.
meanings.sent1: The veinous rock had intricate patterns running through it.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were veinous from years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The old map was so veinous that it was hard to read the details.
meanings.sent4: The veinous wings of the butterfly shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The veinous tree trunk stood out against the smooth bark of the others.
